file_content.text: I am a newborn. My body is clay, my mind a mirror--I need to mend.
But your face speaks to me. I am Hallow Voice, and you have been my echo.
How can you know me if you've been imprisoned?
You recognize me?
The blackness painted your coming, in Rakata colors.
Jedi, to build a path I must know the forest. Speak with me.
Your Republic is a great chorus. Centuries ago, I wished to begin such a song.
But, you cut the cords of our cousin warriors. Are we plunging towards the abyss, too?
I had to decide. I grieve there was no better choice.
I'm sorry for their loss.
Save your speeches, I came for a leader.
I need a general, not a poet.
I greet you both. I took the liberty of streaming data to his chamber, Jedi, informing him of your actions.
One matter remains. I have found stasis chambers holding hundreds of Esh-kha warriors, deeper in the tomb.
I regret this, but... we must ensure only Hallow Voice's followers ever leave Belsavis.
Catch your storm. I will see where this Jedi's footsteps lead.
I swore to help those in need.
Yes. I have learned the name "Jedi" speaks loudly.
A patriarch's footsteps must tread heaviest in the mind.
Those Esh-kha warriors must not be freed. You have to destroy them, to protect your Republic.
I cannot protect the Republic by betraying its values.
That's not our way.
The Rakata destroyed or enslaved other species rather than coexisting. And the consequences surround us.
And repeat your mistakes? No.
You are foolish, but compassionate. I will transmit this to the Esh-kha stasis chambers and show them your forgiveness.
I can't risk unleashing another terror on the Republic. We must do it.
Then kill them.
The chambers are shut down. The Esh-kha felt no pain, and their torment is over.
So a Jedi's footsteps lead through darkness.
I thank you, Jedi, for everything. But I must go--my work is unfinished.
A reconciliation between you and Hallow Voice would send a powerful message.
Make peace with Hallow Voice.
You speak wisely. Perhaps today we can begin anew.
May this wave break these walls, and carry all our brothers home.
Thank you, Lhunu. You've begun your people's redemption.
I won't forget your help.
Our alliance is over.
Now you have your army, that does not surprise me.
Goodbye, to all of you. Your path lies ahead.
We couldn't survive fighting both the Empire and your cousins.
I was protecting the Republic.
I know the stones and thorns of a patriarch's path.
If you follow my orders and fight the Empire, there won't be a problem.
Not if you prove useful.
Know this. My people walk in my footsteps. I lead them rightly or we stand still.
I would silence this Empire's disharmony. But we are a scream, not a whisper. Your Republic may be drowned by us.
Someone who fears his own strength can be trusted to use it wisely.
I have faith in you.
If our "chorus" ends but the Empire is defeated, we can begin again.
The Republic's tough.
Given the choice between you and life under Sith rule, I'll take my chances.
I'll risk it.
Your words ring clear.
But you must be a mirror for us. "Jedi" is not loud enough. Your name must shout.
For us, you have braved flame, faced beasts in shadow and hunted our freedom. What names speak to you?
I think "Sky Hunter" would be appropriate.
Call me Sky Hunter.
"Ember Fist" would suit me.
Know me as Ember Fist.
The name "Silent Teeth" intrigues me.
I can be called Silent Teeth.
Then it will shout to all of us.
Name pleases Scorekeeper, I think.
Hmph. Going native, Jedi?
I like it. Bit easier to say than "Barsen'thor."
Lot of fuss over a code name.
Hallow Voice, the blackness still covers our brothers. We must bring light.
Sky Hunter's footsteps bridge worlds. I will beat a path for you.
Ember Fist's footsteps bridge worlds. I will beat a path for you.
Silent Teeth's footsteps bridge worlds. I will beat a path for you.
I walk in shadow to the open air; my brothers will follow. We will tread the stars again, beside you.
